statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Rider 79, Binghamton 65
article.story: VESTAL, N.Y. (AP) -- Lamar Johnson scored 16 points, including 13 in the final six minutes, to lead Rider to 79-65 come-from-behind victory over Binghamton Saturday. Binghamton (3-3) led 58-54 with six minutes left in the game before the Broncs went on a 15-2 run, 13 of them by Johnson, to take a 69-60 lead with 3:12 remaining. Rider (5-2) made 10 of 11 foul shots in the final 2:48 to preserve the victory. The Broncs outscored Binghamton 43-23 in the second half. Trailing 53-45, Rider went on a 9-1 run, all nine scored by Jason Thompson, to tie the score at 54-54 with 7:27 remaining. Terrance Mouton added 11 points, six assists and five rebounds for the Broncs, while Robbie Myers compiled a career-high six points, making all three of his shots while grabbing a pair of rebounds in nine minutes of action. With the score tied at 43-43, Binghamton went on a 10-2 run, seven points by junior guard Richard Forbes, to take a 53-45 lead with 11:44 remaining. Forbes finished with nine points. Rider led 29-27 before the Bearcats went on a 15-5 run, seven points by Duane James, to take a 42-34 lead, and Binghamton led 42-36 at half time. James finished with a team-high 16 points.
